website_summaries.verdict: With this lightweight, smooth, and effortless to clean scrubber on hand, you’ll never need to buy another scrubbing sponge again.
cons: You’ll still need to scrub a little harder to remove tougher gunk on occasion

customer_reviews.title: About the same as steel wool- but with bribes for five star reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t often write reviews, but I was expecting this to be life changing based on the overwhelmingly postitive reviews this useless utensil had. Upon receipt of my scrubber, I was greeted by a 10% off coupon in exchange for my five star review. Now it all makes sense. I just figured shoppers should be aware that these shady bribes are all over the place on Amazon, and you just can’t trust anything you read! So here’s your honest, 3-Star review, keep your 10%.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it's great. But I also received an offer to get ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried the product. I'm sure it's great. But I also received an offer to get a discount on further purchases should I leave a five star review. I think that is reprehensible.
customer_reviews.author: L. Amber O'Hearn

customer_reviews.title: Discount if you give a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of the good reviews but who knows if they were even real. Product seems ok. It is ferritic ( week fridge magnet makes it move) so we'll see if it is 314 over time I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best cleaning tool for cast iron
customer_reviews.text: Before, I used a plastic scrubber which became encrusted with grease and black from the iron. This tool works perfectly and doesn't wipe off the seasoned surface. It is easy to clean after each use. I highly recommend it for anyone who uses cast iron cookware.
customer_reviews.author: KFenton

customer_reviews.title: Love this Amagabeli Skillet Scraper!
customer_reviews.text: I always wondered how to properly clean my cast iron skillet and have been using nylon brushes. With the brush it was hard getting into all the grooves and crannies but with the this Amagabeli Skillet Scraper it gets the job done without all the hard work, it works well and gives the pan a decent shine and surface, absolutely love it! I would recommend this Scraper to anyone that uses cast iron pan and wants to maintain cleanliness without stripping the surface.
customer_reviews.author: KDC

customer_reviews.title: Up to Snuff
customer_reviews.text: I use on well seasoned, very vintage cast iron My griswold and wagner pans love a nice water swish with this chain mail and then a quick dry and finish with olive oil...Ready for more active duty. I never even use my bloody all clad anymore!Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole C. Kyner

customer_reviews.title: Makes cooking with cast iron so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize for the longest time that there was a product that would make cleaning my cast iron so much easier! I use cast iron mainly to cook scrambled eggs and for the iron (since I don't eat red meat). This cleaner has made it so much easier to clean up after every morning. As soon as the eggs leave the pan, I scrub it under cold water with the cast iron cleaner. When that's done, I dry it with a towel and put it back on the hot burner to make sure all the water evaporates. A new coating of oil, and you're done. Couldn't be easier!
customer_reviews.author: SweetiePieMarie

customer_reviews.title: Alreday falling apart
customer_reviews.text: I have used it hardly 5 times and the rest of the times it was lying on my sink . After few days I noticed that its alreday breaking.. Atleast 4 of the rings from the middle are coming out. I was hoping it to be long lasting but it was a disappointment for 11 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Rings fall apart WAY to easily. . .poor quality control. RETURNED!
customer_reviews.author: TripsPlusOneTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: The concept works but this particular one fell apart in ...
customer_reviews.text: The concept works but this particular one fell apart in about a week. It's cheaply built to say the least
customer_reviews.author: kenneth

customer_reviews.title: This thing is “off the chain”... literally.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this cast iron cleaning tool. While it did help scrub my dirty cookware, the scrubber’s Cleaning power is just shy of mediocre. After about 3 weeks of use, the chain links started to come apart and fall down the sink. We didn’t realize the links were breaking off until it was time to run the disposal... and then: JAMMM! The Several metal links that became lodged afforded me an opportunity to enroll in a crash course on ‘disposal surgery and rehabilitation’. The Greasy and metallic smell that didn’t ever seem wash out of the chain, was an added bonus. See photos of the quality and links falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Links Came Off & Into Garbage Disposal
customer_reviews.text: DIdn't do a great job of cleaning my cast iron skillet at all; and, the next day, when using the garbage disposal, there was an awful grinding noise. What I found was a few of the links from this had unknowingly come off and ended up in the disposal. Only had used it a couple of times and through it away to prevent having to buy another disposal.
customer_reviews.author: L. Akers

customer_reviews.title: Good overall; only one drawback
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. Upsides: Good quality links make it durable. It's a loose enough mesh that food doesn't get stuck in it much and is easily rinsed away when it does. It's a greener and more cost-effective solution than constantly buying brillo pads. Downside: The rings are very rounded so it doesn't have much of a scraping edge to it. Removing food from a cast iron can take some real elbow grease. Also, it wants to slink down into your garbage disposal, so be aware of where it is before you turn yours on (We haven't done it yet, but we've had a couple close calls).
customer_reviews.author: R. Herman

customer_reviews.title: It works, but don't trust all of the 5 star reviews.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I would have given the product 5 stars, but they included a coupon for a free/discounted product if you left a 5-star review for them. -2 for trying to cheat the system.
customer_reviews.author: M. Breon

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Much a Must Have for Cast Iron
customer_reviews.text: Cast Iron is magic for big pots but it has its drawbacks - you can't air dry it nor use soap to clean it. The best you can hope for is to scrape out out thoroughly, and that's where this "chain mail" tool comes in. It really works - doesn't mar your seasoned areas and the resulting pot looks just about like new. The cleaning process is fast and easy - just shuffle this cleaning tool around the bottom of your pan - only takes a minute or so. I put it in the dishwasher afterwards, then air dry it - it's working out well for my needs and I can't think of anything else that would suit the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: thenekkidtruth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product! So glad I found it!
customer_reviews.text: I am do pleased with this product! The quality is outstanding! The very last scrubber I will by. I o let use cast iron pans and this works amazingly. It also works great on pots and bowls and glasses. I have kids so not every dish gets rinsed out right away and sometimes pasta gets baked to the dish. No match for this amazing product. I already have another one on order for my dad who also only cooks with cast iron pans. I am planning on buying a handful more for Christmas presents! You can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: MamaOwl

customer_reviews.title: Works Beautifully
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended chain mail for cleaning cast-iron cookware. I have to admit, it sounded odd, but after a bit of shopping around, I chose Amagabeli based on the many positive reviews. I can't really explain why it works so much better than those plastic and silicone scrubbers, but it does. Stuck-on food bits that would've had be scrubbing hard for several minutes while submerging my hands in near-scalding water with my old scrubbers came off with a half-dozen firm swipes of chain mail. I highly recommend this product for anyone who owns cast-iron cookware.
customer_reviews.author: TRR5

customer_reviews.title: Gentle on your hands
customer_reviews.text: Different from regular metal scrubbers which with the use start to have metal threads that get stuck in certain part of the pots or hurt your nails and fingers; this stainless steel scrub cleaner does not. It is perfect for cast iron pans and pots. I even use it gently on ceramic pans that the sponge cannot clean but a regular metal scrubber will be too hard for the ceramic. The only thing is that this stainless steel is not strong enough sometimes to scrub off burnt or stuck on food in stainless steel pans; I still have to use a metal scrubber.
customer_reviews.author: Lemon Grove

customer_reviews.title: Saved my seasoning my girlfriend nearly killed
customer_reviews.text: This saved my well loved and well seasoned cast iron from my girlfriends cooking. One morning she surprised me with eggs w/ cheese for breakfast, she knows the rule don't clean my cast iron. Loved my breakfast in bed surprise hated my glued mess. I wasn't sure how to clean without destroying my seasoning, seen somewhere to use this so I gave it a try. It sucked seeing my favorite pan dirty for a week and not use it as I normally do daily. With some hot water and rubbing everything came off with minimal damage to my seasoning. I've only used this once but im already loving it for saving my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M. Schloegel Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Scratches le creuset
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with this purchase, I used it once to clean my le creuset pan and immediately notice some scratches on the bottom so I stopped using, do NOT purchase this to clean le creuset pans! Wish I could return it and get a refund!
customer_reviews.author: SLS

customer_reviews.title: Did the Trick! :-)
customer_reviews.text: Love vintage as well as new cast iron skillets and some needed work! Well this cast iron cleaner did the trick by running warm water on skillets while scouring with the cleaner. Dried them on hot stove top then oiled them before storing. You can also oil and put in 350 degree oven for 1 hr. in order to season the your cast iron. I recommend this item to keep your cast iron non-stick!
customer_reviews.author: Tootsie

customer_reviews.title: Works better than a Steel Wool but NO Rust
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use it to clean my cast iron pan and my wire air fryer. It cleans the metal very well, but won’t cause any damage. The material is high quality and sturdy. The product itself is very easy to cleans as well, you just need to wash it with soap like a towel, then hang it and let it air dry. There’s a ring for you to hang it. It definitely cleans better than a steel wool, easier grab, and the best part is it won’t rust, so you can keep using it over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Not rough on the hands
customer_reviews.text: Heard people raving about these to clean their cast iron. Well, it deserves praise. Bought a second to use for outside cleaning purposes so no cross contamination. In the kitchen, I used a clamp style paper clip, clipped it to a glass shelf can hang this item so it is always ready. Under it I have a small glass dish with sponge, etc. so no drips on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. It's approx 6" x 6" and the rings are very smooth. I used to use a brillo pad but was worried I was beginning to scratch my cast iron pan. This does the job perfectly. Minor notes: When using, the chainmail heats up rather quickly and becomes difficult to handle. I found it easy to simply grab the chainmail with a normal scrubbing pad. It's not going to be as rough on stuck foods as a brillo pad but it's good enough to get the job done. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: A must have for cast iron
customer_reviews.text: I use this chain and some metal scrubs to clean both my cast-iron and my carbon steel pan. Using this my cast-iron pan looks brand new and has lasted a long time. I also don’t have to re-season it that often with this cleaner. If you’ve never used a chain before to clean you may wonder how it works but once you use it you’ll see it’s quite easy. If you’re a cast-iron lover then you have to have this for your cleaning needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Jean

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cleaning scrubber
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these for just about a year, and found it amazing for cleaning just about any pot or pan that had any cooked on or burnt on bits. Cast iron cleaned up like new. There rings are smooth and the closings uniform so ours had no sharp edges. Just don't run it through a disposal - very hard on both the stainless steel mesh and the disposal... thus we needed a new one
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Cleaning Cast Iron
customer_reviews.text: The Amagabeli 8” x 8” 316 Stainless Steel Cast Iron Cleaner Chainmail Scrubber worked better than I imagined for cleaning my cast iron pots and pans. I use the scrubber along with Camp Chef cast iron cleaner. Together, they remove all residue and clean it without removing the seasoning. After that, all I have to do is heat up the pan and apply a layer of cooking oil and it's ready to use again. I had always hesitated to use cast iron before due to the hassle of being able to properly clean after cooking on them. This scrubber has changed that and I now regularly use my cast iron pans.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item as it looked similar to what my grandmother used on her cast iron pans. I have 2 cast iron fry pans...each one has been passed down to me by both of my grandmothers. That being said, they are quite old and I love them, but they needed a good cleaning. The day I received the Stainless Steel Cast Iron Cleaner I used it. I have to admit I was skeptical, but OMG....they worked magic on these pans. Yes I did use a little elbow grease, but it was worth it. They both look amazing....in fact, when my granddaughter saw them she placed dibs on one of the pans!!! They look brand new!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Damicis

customer_reviews.title: FAKE ADVERTISEMENT! the rings are NOT WELDED!
customer_reviews.text: it is shameful that Amazon lets its sellers so blatantly misrepresent their products. The descriptiin states that the rings are "machine welded", but they are NOT at all welded; in fact several sre NOT EVEN CLOSED. For everyday use, that may be fine; but for heavy duty use, the mesh comes apart at the least bending of any ring. SHAMEFUL LIARS!!!
customer_reviews.author: AlchemistOfLife

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I got my mother's cast iron pan when she transitioned and it had a bunch of caked on food from 60 years of cooking. It takes some elbow grease, but most of it has come off. Each time I "wash" it with water, I do a scrub a little more and soon it will be as good as new while still retaining it's oiled surface.
customer_reviews.author: Anne NC

customer_reviews.title: Pretty heavy for the size of it
customer_reviews.text: This thing works remarkably well. Pretty heavy for the size of it, I've used it about 30 times now to clean cast iron griddles and pans and wonder why I never heard of using chain mail years ago. Sometimes I use a tiny bit of Dawn but usually can get by with just some warm water and the cast iron heated to where you can still touch it but it's warm to very warm. I think the seasoning really benefits from this as it doesn't seem to hurt it at all.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: broke almost as soon as I used it
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clean our cast iron grill. It did not hold up through the first cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: dearydew

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Don't like this product. It is not good for the intended purpose consider the advertisement to be misleading. It brings no instructions. I will not use it again because I don't want to damage my cast iron products.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia I. Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: If you have cast iron products you know how much of a hassle they are to clean, re-season and dry. This steel scrubby makes cleaning so easy. After the skillet is almost all the way cooled down I put a little water in and scrub. Continue and rinse as needed, dry the skillet and put it in the oven on a low setting to dry and you’re done! I ended up buying my mom one of these for Christmas. And, I’m pretty sure these things last as long as the cast iron!
customer_reviews.author: S Gillane

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely mid evil
customer_reviews.text: I love how this simple product gets the job done! Burnt tortillas on my cast iron griddle (nice job son) has no chance now with these little chain links. My only concern at this time is if these links will rust over time. After each use, I lay out on a drying mat and it’s been sufficient in drying it 100%. Only time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: 5/5 Well-Deserved Stars for Chain Mail!!!
customer_reviews.text: A friend turned me on to the benefits of cleaning cast iron with chain mail. She also showed me how easy it was to toss flat into the dishwasher for a super-clean. What I didn’t know when I ordered this is its many, many uses. I’ve used it to (carefully) clean glass as well as to remove cooked-on stains from the bottom of porcelain pan. Read the instructions! I hope you find this as useful as I have!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Hobensack

customer_reviews.title: Links are too large to work as well as other brands
customer_reviews.text: Eh. I have a similar one of these with smaller links that I love. The larger links slide over food instead of getting it off the dishes and they can't get into the smaller areas of dishes or corners of pots and pans. Got this one to keep on my boat but will be getting another one with the smaller links.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Dutton

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I asked my sister what she used for her cast iron because I had so much trouble getting mine clean. She recommended the chainmail scrubber so I tried it. Oh my word! It was so easy to use and did not take long at all to clean my pans! Since it is stainless steal it should last a long time. And when it comes time to clean it, I toss it in the silverware basket in my dishwasher. I would recommend this to anyone who uses cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product had great reviews, which is why I thought this would be a great solution to cleaning my cast iron pans. DO NOT BUY for this purpose. I wish it did what everyone is claiming. Also hoping the bribe offered when I opened the package, to leave a five star review, isn’t the reason why there are great reviews for a product that doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly this works but look at the measurements!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cream black spots on my Lodge cast iron griddle and it residue came off in under two minutes. It using take me 15-20 minutes to clean the griddle. I now can clean my cast iron grills in a few minute. I love the size because I have small hands. I would like to get a bigger one as well. So far after using it a few times, it had not broken or shows signs of wear and tear. I hope it lasts a long time but for the price I got it at, id more than likely buy a new one it is that good. Wonderful Quality!
customer_reviews.author: SuspiroDeuce

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes cleaning cast iron a breeze, as well as precleaning dishes for the dishwasher. And I just throw it in the dishwasher silverware cage when it gets too dirty. I will never be without one again. I didn't choose the dishwashing life. The dishwashing life chose me, and this thing makes it a way better one.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My wife and I "rediscovered" the cast iron cookware we grew up with. We fell into the stainless and non-stick hype of the 80s and 90s. Nothing ever met our expectations or the representations of the ads. A few years ago, we decided to try some cast iron skillets we "inherited." We will never go back. It took a while to reseason the skillets but once done, it was amazing. Cleaning without heaving to reseason the cookware can be problematic; howver, stainless chainmail does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: SMONK

customer_reviews.title: Essential to anyone who uses cast iron cookware
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cast iron skillet a couple month ago and have been struggling with the best way to clean it. I was using baking soda and a plastic scraper but felt it was taking to long and removing too much essential seasoning from the skillet. Enter the chainmail: this thing is awesome! It cleans the skillet quickly and effectively, especially when it's still hot. Food rinses out of the chainmail easily and boom I'm done, and I can move on with my life. It does not remove the seasoning like other methods of cleaning a cast iron skillet. I love this product and I would recommend it as an essential to anyone who uses cast iron cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Snyder

customer_reviews.title: I just like it
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, I just like it. bought one, returned it, missed it - and had to have it back, so I bought it again. one guy expected it to be magic, it is not magic, but is is real nice and I like it better than the varieties of steel wool. seems well made with no sharp edges to me, hope that helps. SW
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Not just for cast iron!!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Not just for cast iron!! If you've ever tried to clean a bottle with a bottle brush that doesn't quite reach all the grooves, this is what to use. Put this iin your bottle or jar, add some dish soap and a bit of hot water, drop this chainmail in the bottle and swish it around! It has even removed water stains from bottles. It's great on all stainless pots and pans too. Really great product. I purchased one for my son, and one for a neighbor that collects vintage cast iron pots and pans. We all love it!
customer_reviews.author: breadlady

customer_reviews.title: Does what I needed to clean my cast iron pan.
customer_reviews.text: We have a Le Cruset cast iron pan that I haven't been able to get clean. I saw this item and read reviews and thought I'd give it a try. I was amazed at how easily it removed the buildup that had acquired over time. I would recommend this mesh tool to anyone having the problem I did.
customer_reviews.author: W. Coats

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of using salt and a paper towel to clean my cast iron pans. I could never get all the pits and pieces of food removed. With the Amagabeli 8"x6" stainless steel chainmail scrubber, my pans are clean. And, the seasoning remains intact. This thing is amazing. It does what it's supposed to do and doesn't what it's not supposed to do. If you cook with cast iron, get one. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: HatSon2

customer_reviews.title: nice idea
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use at work to clean a huge mixer that has rusting issues and we ran out of the scratchies that we normally use so I thought I would try these. I had a difficult time hanging onto it but that is because my hands/wrists are worn out so I think these would work good if you had no hand/wrist issues.
customer_reviews.author: karen jackson

customer_reviews.title: This is no gimmick
customer_reviews.text: This little chainmail scrubber works amazingly. I use it for hard to reach areas like skinny water bottles and for non stick pans. Works great on both. I had some dried coffee in the grooves of my Moka Pot from over the years and this thing got it looking almost new. A little bit of soap goes a long way and it really breaks through dried, stuck on, food like protein shake left in the blender cup.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: use it on so many things.
customer_reviews.text: It was a complete wow on the cast iron skillet. Then a champ on stainless steel. Ok then I tried it on some stuck on food on my plates, and began to use it on the stove top. This is the handiest thing in the kitchen. I am very very pleased with it. It does not scratch. Feels good on my hands too. Amazing little thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dsigns

customer_reviews.title: It works great on my trial test on old cookie sheet
customer_reviews.text: I finally tried this product. It works great on my trial test on old cookie sheet. I did the wax on,wax off method. Got my sheet clean and great upper arm exercise. Sore the next day. Well made, works as described and durable. It does leave hands stained and smells like steel so use gloves if you're doing a big job. Works great on cast iron pans that have been treated and on coffee pot. Great idea, great design, does what it is described to do. I will go looking for more items to clean plus get a fantastic arm exercise workout . Fantastic product, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: G2

customer_reviews.title: This is great for all my cast iron pans
customer_reviews.text: This is great for all my cast iron pans. I have to be careful to use it only in the sink without the disposer because it is very slippery. My only problem (mine, not the chain mail scrubber) is that I haven't figured out how to hold it for the greatest efficiency. I'm sure I'll get the hang of it with practice. All in all, it's a great scrubber for cast iron cookware and I suspect it will be good for stainless steel and aluminum, too, for stuck on food, since it is smooth so unlikely to scratch.
customer_reviews.author: debdouc

customer_reviews.title: Brought life back into our well seasoned pant!
customer_reviews.text: We take excellent care of our cast iron. It’s a staple In our kitchen. However even with taking good care of the skillet it still started flaking and seemed like it was rusting. I blame our hard water. Anyway this product completely cleared all the flaking without starting over on our well seasoned cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Lee

customer_reviews.title: Chainmail scrubber
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find my chainmail scrubber for a while after i bought it. my room mate and I share clothing and she was wearing it as a chainmail bikini for a while. When I finally got it back I bleached and washed it 10 times and it works great to clean the cast iron pans. My room mate is moving out next week.
customer_reviews.author: Sidowy

customer_reviews.title: This is a game changer.
customer_reviews.text: Despite many efforts of trying to clean and get my cast iron skillets/pots to be non-stick over the years, I just couldn't get it right. Decided to give this crazy-chain-linked contraption a try--fully anticipating it scratching the pots all up--yet, I couldn't be more delighted to say it works! It works well! It's easy to use too! I'm elated over this because my cast iron skillets are finally non-stick and clean, living the lives they deserve. Rescue your cast iron and get this--you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie A Hooker

customer_reviews.title: this is the one product you can't find easily. I am an avid user of cast iron ...
customer_reviews.text: this is the one product you can't find easily. I am an avid user of cast iron skillets. When they are seasoned properly you don't get much if any sticking. But when you do you definitely DON'T want to use an abrasive scratch pad on it. This is so nice because it will get the sticky stuff, the stuck on fat skin from meats off so easily and it won't scratch your cast iron pan. I love this... and I've so happy to have finally found the one product I will use forever on my cast iron pans and lids.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. Axleson

customer_reviews.title: Super Simple
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the metal is great, I can already tell it's not going to fall apart or rust. This has honestly made cleaning cast iron so much easier for me. I actually used to stay away from using cast iron as I dreaded the cleaning part after. I admit, I had to watch a YouTube video on how to use one of these, but I'm glad I did as I probably would have ended up using it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: A must for cleaning cast iron
customer_reviews.text: This may be the best kitchen accessory I didn't know I needed. I use this to scrub my cast iron cookware, and it does the best job of cleaning without soap than anything else I've tried. My cast iron pieces have never been in better shape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Best Idea in Kitchen Gadgets in My Lifetime
customer_reviews.text: We have at least 6 pieces of cast iron cookware in this house and this is the first really good way to easily clean them. Even though brillo pads are cheaper, this is more economical in the long run and I don't have to deal with rust from brillo pads. I still sneak in a little soap now and then but hubby doesn't complain as much that I'm ruining the seasoning. Overall a great idea. I'm surprised our grandmothers never thought of this.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't Want To Be Without It
customer_reviews.text: Transitioned to cast iron skillets within the past year because I got tired of my non-stick pans losing their effectiveness. This is indispensable for cleaning off any build up while maintaining the cast iron's ability to release foods.
customer_reviews.author: tcwalter

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time and as advertised. Lighter than I expected but well mad
customer_reviews.text: Only reason for a 4 star rather than 5 was that while it had some effect on a cast iron grill pan it was ridged so the chainmail did not get between the ridges. Tried multiple ways to use it in the ridges but ended up using a BBQ slat cleaner to finish off the job. I'll probably buy a flat pan as it will be easier to clean, as I like the chainmail.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwiruss

customer_reviews.title: Not just for cast iron...
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well on our decade old seasoned cast iron pan PLUS cleans coffee stains out of my husband's insulated travel mugs (Contigo) - just swirl with minimal water and some dish soap, can use a bottle brush to move the scrubber up the sides. This gets what the bottle brush can't. Also cleaned some glass vases - again with the water/soap/swirl. More efficient than the old marble trick to clean a vase. Another simple product that does what it states and makes cleaning easier. We just bought a second one for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Doll

customer_reviews.title: Take care of your cast iron by cleaning them easily & well
customer_reviews.text: The review questions include “easy to remove” after “easy to clean”, not sure what they mean but yes, easy to clean after scrubbing our cast iron cookware, the scrubber works very well that I have sent the link to the product to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Grid

customer_reviews.title: A product you must have when dishwashing
customer_reviews.text: This tiny stainless steel cleaner does its job really well. I have a long time trouble cleaning my cast iron pan and stew pot using the sponge dishwasher, even with the hard scrubbing side. However after using the product which is highly recommended by my friend, the dishwashing has never been so easy. Just sever soft scrub with the stainless steel cleaner, all the stuff stick on the bottom of the pot has gone. They just gone. The little cleaner itself is so easily self-cleaner that you just need to put it under the faucet, then it's brand new as it is before. Very solid product must have.
customer_reviews.author: yonghai

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have several cast iron pans. My brother-n-law recommended this to me for cleaning them to help keep the seasoning. It works great. Water and one of these cleans them right up. It does not rust. Feels heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Forget the brush, steel wool and sponges! This WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: This is a late review after 6 months of use and abuse repeatedly at home and several camping trips on a variety of items. If you own any cast iron pans, griddle or a steel seasoned wok, you need this! AWESOME! Better than anything else I've ever tried. Simple to use cleaning with hot water (hotter the better). Then re coat your seasoned pan/griddle/wok after heating it up to dry with some high heat temp cooking oil or seasoning oil. Chain cleans easy with hot soapy water or hang inside dishwasher when running it. Air dry before storage. Very strong and well built, will last forever I expect.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: My pan is about 13 inches and the cleaner size is perfect for working on it
customer_reviews.text: I bought the chain mail scrubber for my cast iron skillet which I almost use every day . Before I got the scrubber, I always had sticky stuff issue with my pan but since I start cleaning it with my stainless steel scrubber, the big issue has been totally resolved. It can get all the cooking grime off your pans with ease. The most important thing is that it won’t remove the seasoning or scratch the pan . My pan is about 13 inches and the cleaner size is perfect for working on it. I have to say, I just did a perfect purchase from the seller Amagabeli .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not useful
customer_reviews.text: The links are too large. Required multiple (5+) passes to scrub stuck food. Also too large to use on a slotted iron pan; would not conform to the grooves to clean them. Nicely made and appears very durable, though.
customer_reviews.author: kerriluvssun

customer_reviews.title: Try it, you’ll love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Amazed how it cleans my iron skillets. Only disappointment was it won’t fit through a small neck bottle. Was hoping it would to aid in cleaning out- like a humming bird feeder, etc. But awesome for all other tasks.
customer_reviews.author: LGB

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen staple
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use on the two cast iron pans I am learning how to use. I've found myself using this to get smells of garlic or seafood off my hands an to remove food from other dishes that won't be damaged by an abrasive like this.
customer_reviews.author: Annah

customer_reviews.title: Work's really well!
customer_reviews.text: I have spent countless hours looking for ways to effectively clean my cast iron pans, but it was always difficult to get the surface clean enough with burnt on food without taking off the built up finish. This Stainless Steel pad works to do just that! In a few minutes, the pan that I had been trying to get clean for about a week (which prompted me to buy this) was clean without the seasoned finish marred at all. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maura M

customer_reviews.title: I think this would be better if the individual rings were a little smaller
customer_reviews.text: I think this would be better if the individual rings were a little smaller. It was a little too "rough" for my cast iron frying pan (had to sand it and reseason it after using this). I don't use it on cast iron or anything similar to Teflon; it works well on other surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: ScotchBonnet

customer_reviews.title: If you have a cast iron pan, get this plain and simple
customer_reviews.text: I have several cast iron pans in various forms. They are relatively new, and less "well" seasoned than they could be so far because I cook drier less oily food in them. Honestly they're great but they DO stick food to them... enter this chain mail scrubber. I've easily removed burned on rice, powdered spices, etc. with this pad and plain running water. I was concerned that it would be too aggressive being metal on metal, but it's actually super gentle and no sharp edges where the rings join. I like it almost as much as cooking in cast iron. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hamner

customer_reviews.title: where has it been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: This is so perfect for cleaning cast iron skillets, it's amazing. I don't know why we didn't have it years ago. So easy to clean and work with, easy on your hands, cleans out caked on food. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Mcateer

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use. Doesn't clean well.
customer_reviews.text: product does not clean. also product has no way to separate your hand from the heat, so you can apply force without burning yourself. Bad design. Had to go back and clean with a sponge after using this.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good for the big stuff
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered a couple of these, one for myself and one for a friend. They work great for knocking big chunks off of my cast iron and out of my stainless cookware but they don't work well for scrubbing so I always go back to my old stainless steel scrubber. I'm updating my review and giving them a 5 star rating because this company has absolutely AMAZING customer service. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: MeadowlarkMT

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it states. Ive cleaned a few very sticky and grimy cast iron pans. It scrubs off the grime but leaves the seasoning intact. The unit itself is well made and big enough to use easily. Cleaning the mesh by hand is quite simple. I use dish soap in my hand and rub the mesh between both hands and then rinse it off.
customer_reviews.author: AlTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: Best product to clean our cast iron pans
customer_reviews.text: At 1st we were wondering if we should spend $12 to clean a couple of $10 cast iron pans but the regular cleaning scrubbers we used dint do a good enough job and left the scrubber with a lot of stains so we thought of giving this chain a try. Removes the built up gunk and food residue without much effort. Just put the chain in dishwasher after cleaning your pan. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jaya

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Easy to clean. Flexible and can travel. I got so tired of typical scrubbers. This is perfect for cast iron pans. Cleans them right away, no fuss. Should not be used on Teflon or non-stick pans.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: But I can say that it cleans them very easily. This product also hasn't rusted after a year ...
customer_reviews.text: This product might be magic. I can use this on our cast iron cooking pans without ruining them or completely striping them of their oil coating. How it cleans cooked in food bits, I couldn't say. But I can say that it cleans them very easily. This product also hasn't rusted after a year of use, and when we want to clean that we either put it in the dishwasher or run soap through it and then hang it up to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Shipman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This does an amazing job at cleaning my cast iron pan! I used to use a little scrub burgs with some coarse salt and water, now I don’t even need the abrasive quality of the salt, just this! A must if you use cast iron often!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for cast iron skillets.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, never buy another "rat nest ball type" scouring pad again. This product does what it claims. Keeps my cast iron skillets clean with out having to reconditioning before next use. This product is simple to clean. Set in dishsoap/water for a couple minutes, rinse and pay dry. As we know, one never used soapy water on your CI cooking surface. Other store bought pads always cause reconditioning, not this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using cast iron for the better part of 60 years and had always cleaned it like my grandmother did - salt, oil and elbow grease. Chainmail took a few seconds to clean as compared with a few minutes the old way and so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: whistler's daughter

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: This Amagabeli stainless skillet scraper comes with a big label on it that states it is “Made in China”. I am writing this review because I tried to buy American-made or even European-made, but was mislead by the Question section for this product wherein someone answered that this scraper is made somewhere in England. It is not made in England, rather it clearly states that it is made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa O.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for cast iron skillet
customer_reviews.text: If you cook with a cast iron skillet and are tired of tearing up sponges cleaning it- buy this item. It works great for cleaning the tough caked on material. Also, pro tip-- once you are done cleaning, put your cast iron skillet back on the stove to dry off water and prevent rust.
customer_reviews.author: Jayziggy

customer_reviews.title: A must have for cast iron.
customer_reviews.text: This has made cleaning my cast iron so easy! We used to struggle with cleaning it and it would take forever. Now it’s like a few seconds. It also doesn’t mess up the seasoning which is the best part. This is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: B. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: When food is really stuck on and scraping it with a spatula isn't getting everything easily, this thing works great
customer_reviews.text: I'm relatively new to cooking with cast iron but the first thing that I discovered was that for certain meals, the pad is a pain in the arse to clean. When food is really stuck on and scraping it with a spatula isn't getting everything easily, this thing works great. I like the weight of it in my hand and how it feels when I scrub the pan with it, and I especially like that it is machine washable.
customer_reviews.author: russraymond

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love it...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these in mid October...given a squirt of dish liquid, it easily cleans cast iron, stainless cookware, Corningware and crusted oven surfaces... and it does it WITHOUT SCRATCHING. When you're done, just rinse it out, hang it on a hook, and its ready for next time...no more nasty, rusting steel wool pads to deal with. Feels good in your hand and looks like it will outlast the owner...Buying more for Xmas stocking stuffers.
customer_reviews.author: brainsalad

customer_reviews.title: Great for cast iron
customer_reviews.text: It makes my cast iron easy to clean, and when I'm done all it takes is a little massage with dish soap plus a good rinse and it's ready for next time. The ONLY thing I don't like is that the ring it hangs from isn't stainless steel, and it is subject to rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Sean and Michele

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: How have I lived this long without knowing about this product? It works excellently! Will last a very long time. Cleans easily. You won't be sorry you bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: works great on my cast iron skillets
customer_reviews.text: A friend told me about this ...and I ordered it and am thrilled. wish I knew about this product earlier to clean my cast iron skillets. No more Teflon at my house
customer_reviews.author: O-H-I-O Buckeye Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Cast Iron Cooking Pans and Skillets
customer_reviews.text: This was a spur of the moment buy and I was hesitant to believe it would work as well as other reviewers have written. Well I am happy to say I am very happy and amazed at how well it cleans cast iron. Even for just a spot of stubborn cheese that won't come off, this "rag" works wonders!. It quickly cleaned all my cooked on spots that I couldn't remove by any other method. I hope you enjoy this product as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Jody  Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: I have had my cast iron pan a few years and try to only clean it with salt and a scrub brush. Sometimes those last burnt on bits just won't come off and have to use a scrubbie and detergent. I first tried this on an aluminum cookie sheet that I cooked turkey meatballs on. The gunk slid off. I just tried it on my cast iron and "voila!" no scrubbie needed. Just the salt and this. LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: PAULA B

customer_reviews.title: a must have if you own cast iron or steel cookware
customer_reviews.text: effectively cleans CI of the toughest sticky food residue without removing the seasoning. great for stainless also. I love it and highly recommend. Arrived on time and works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Tewksbury customer

customer_reviews.title: This review seems to be getting deleted
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to work that well. A stiff bristled brush works better. Plus when you use it, it just collects all the grease and dirt then you need to spend extra time cleaning it. More of a pain to use than anything.
customer_reviews.author: NyChowd

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite cleaning tool!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for cast iron. Any food stuck to the pan comes off easily and you don’t have pieces of food stick to the scrubber like you would a sponge or brush, therefore more sanitary to use. I also use it my new favorite cleaning toolon glass casserole pans and stainless steel. Very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: victoria petty

customer_reviews.title: Works better than salt!
customer_reviews.text: Since purchasing this product I have only had an opportunity to use it a handful of times. The product seems to be good quality and does a great job cleaning my cast iron pans. Previously I had been using course salt to scrub them out. This seems to be a better option with less sodium. Will update after I use it more. Some of the previous reviews I have read talked about the item falling apart. So far mine has held up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Skewed

customer_reviews.title: Super for cleaning cast iron
customer_reviews.text: If you have trouble cleaning cast iron or your normal cleaning method removes too much of the seasoning, then get one of these. 99% of the time i can clean my cast iron skillets and ovens with just water and this scrubber and no soap is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Isaacson

customer_reviews.title: Last accessory you’ll need for your cast-iron
customer_reviews.text: We love this specialty scrubber! I like that we can really scrub to get off food, but doesn’t hurt the seasoned-finish of our cast iron pans. Nice to have something specific so no accidental soap sours the non-stick finishes we have acheived. And bonus: this scrubber itself can be washed with soap, and just should be rinsed thoroughly before being used again. We draped it across the faucet to let dry.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easy.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what I did before this thing. Ruined scrubbers and Brillo pads piled up. You can use this without soaking your pan first which decreases the need for as much seasoning. A well seasoned pan won’t need this as much, but when stuff does get crusted on, this works.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip kennedy

product_meta.title: Amagabeli 8"x6" Stainless Steel Cast Iron Cleaner 316L Chainmail Scrubber for Cast Iron Pan Pre-Seasoned Pan Dutch Ovens Waffle Iron Pans Scraper Cast Iron Grill Scraper Skillet Scraper
feature_bullets: DURABILITY - This cast iron skillet cleaner is handmade rings by Premium 316L Stainless steel, It is ideal for cleaning all your cast iron cookware, such as cast iron pans , pre seasoned cast iron , skillets, dutch ovens , camp chef griddles , waffle irons and so on . Boasting unmatched durability and built to last as long as your cast iron products. Each chainmail ring is designed with the highest quality food grade stainless steel in the industry to be smooth enough for pans

EASE OF USE - This household scouring pads / iron cast cleaner / household cleaning brushes or household cleaning tool helps to effortlessly clean all your cast iron products without stripping away accumulated flavor and seasoning or scratching your pans. Just see the magic of our cast iron cleaner work wonders and make cleaning a breeze through. Scrub any residue with warm water which will release quickly and easily. No soap or harsh detergents needed. Perfect for cast iron restoration.

PERFECTED - Each ring is handcrafted with smooth edging for strength and comfort to protect the seasoning of your pans. It is manufactured with high grade restaurant quality premium Grade Stainless Steel. Lightweight and convenient for cooking in home, camping or travel. Ultra-hygienic and dishwasher safe household scouring pad , kitchen cleaner , replacement of household cleaning brushes. Perfect household cleaning tool, grilling & BBQ Utensil, grill scrapers , outdoor cooking accessories.

ALL PURPOSE USE -Treasured by chefs as cookware accessories a cast iron cleaner & scraper for pans, cast iron skillet, griddle, dutch oven, pot,waffle maker, wok, glassware, Pyrex, casseroles,baking pan, tea pot, cookie sheet, cauldron, tortilla press, hibachi, cornbread, pie pan,Terracotta, Clay pot and more! A kitchen utensil & gadget Suitable for all kinds of cast iron pan kitchen cookware.
